title: Remember ROM
description: Allows the website to remember the file location of the ROM you wish to use in the future.

title: Tournament Safe ROM
description:
Verifies that the ROM provided is an original Final Fantasy 1 ROM. If the ROM has been modified beyond certain allowances (the sprites for the main heroes on the map and in battle may be changed, as well as the vehicles), a randomized ROM will fail to generate and the site will spit out the following error: -- FAILURE: file has been modified --

When this flag is turned on, the Damage Tile Flicker and Spellcasting Flash are also disabled, regardless of the preferences selected.
Additionally, the Crop Fiendly flag is enabled, regardless of the preferences selected.

title: Generate Spoiler Log!
description:
Download a spoiler log for the current seed. The resulting ROM's randomization will be different than if the log had not been generated in order to prevent cheating in races.
Note: You may be asked by your browser to allow downloading multiple files when using this option.

title: Hide Flags
description:
Hides all flags to create a mystery flagset that can then be distributed. Useful for tournament and challenge race settings.
 This flag cannot be disabled once clicked; you will need to hit the Reset button to restore functionality to the site (and this will, in turn, wipe the hidden flags selected). Make sure to save your flagset before you use this flag.

title: Ribbon
description: Shattered spreads the resistances across many armor pieces. Each Element occurs multiple times. It tries to ensure that every class can attain full protection.

title: Reversed Dungeons
description: Where meaningfully possible, swaps entrance and exit stairs; otherwise, modifies the location of entrance stairs. Some floors are also slightly modified to allow for meaningful relocation of stairs.

title: No Empty Scripts
description:
Prevents non-boss scripts from being empty.
Without this flag, enemies will be more likely to have scripts with both skills and spells. This flag results in spreading them out more, giving about 25% more enemies with scripts on average with a Vanilla Script Count.

title: Mermaid Prison
description: Locks all doors on the Mermaid Floor in Sea Shrine, so that the KEY is now required to access the treasures on that floor.

title: Later Loose
description: Makes later placement of loose items more likely.

title: Everything has a Script
description:
Controls how many non-boss enemies will have a script. Vanilla just shuffles the scripts, all other settings assign them randomly.

Pirates are safe unless declared unsafe.

title: Everything has a Touch
description:
Controls how many non-boss enemies will have a touch effect.

Pirates are safe unless declared unsafe.

title: Import Resource Pack
description: Imports into the game various custom assets like sprites, gamescript and worldmap grouped in a single zip package. See Resources for more info.

title: Disable Minimap
description: Disables the minimap.

title: Item Magic Shuffling
description:
Vanilla: Vanilla item magic or weaponizer/armorcrafter behavior.

Randomized: Change item magic based on Item Magic Pool below (among equipment that normally casts spells when used).

None: No item magic.

Random: Any of the above.

title: Item Magic Pool
description:
Sets the pool of Spells for item magic shuffling.

All Magic: All valid spells.

Balanced: Removes too weak and too strong spells.

Low: Removes too strong spells.

Support: Removes too strong spells and all damage spells.

Random: Any of the above.

title: Quick Minimap Load
description: Speeds up loading of the minimap.

title: Enable Soft in Battle
description: Makes the SOFT spell and the SOFT potion work in battle.

title: Enable Life in Battle
description: Makes the LIFE spell, the LIF2 spell and the PHNIX potion (if enabled) work in battle.

title: Key Item Placement
description:
Guided: This algorithm uses a semifixed placement order that will always open up the seed with an early SHIP and CANAL.

Predictive: More powerful algorithm that does not rely on a fixed item order. This allows for more flexibility like allowing early fetch quests or opening a seed up with the CANOE instead of the SHIP. It can better handle alternate overworlds and Floor Entrance seeds.

Predictive Unsafe: Removes Safety Checks that prevent the Predictive Algorithm from forcing you into high level dungeons early.

title: Loose Placement
description:
Chaotic: Random Chests and NPCs. Tends to put more key items into larger dungeons.

Spread: Tries to spread out the loose items into different dungeons and gatings. With F/E it tries to spread out the items to different entrances/gatings.

Forward: Additionally tries to place loose items into newly opened up areas. It creates key item chains where one key item leads to the next, drives items out into the last corners of the world and can create some really nice fetch quest chains.

title: Favor NPCs
description:
Makes it more likely for any loose items to land on NPCs.
Requires that one (or both) of the "Main NPCs" or "Fetch Quest NPCs" flags above are not set.

title: Fun Enemy Names
description: Changes enemy names in the generated seed. Most of the name changes in this setting are the result of various community memes over the years and may not make sense to newer players.

title: Team STEAK
description:
Modifies the Tyro/T-Rex sprite to reflect the age old rivalry between two teams.
 Team Tyro believes firmly in the sanctity of Tyro life while Team Steak believes in the sanctity of Tyro meat dinners. Choosing Team Steak will make it clear what you see when confronting these majestic-but-delicious creatures.

title: Multi-instrumentalist Sara
description: Randomly change Princess Sara's Lute to another instrument from a list of over 70 different, community-contributed options.

title: Titan's Favorite Snack
description:
Randomly change Titan's RUBY to another snack from 100 different, community-contributed options.
[grid][r]{l}{i}Ruby|{l}Default / Vanilla[r]{l}{i}Other Minerals|{l}Rocks or similar Titan cuisine[r]{l}{i}Junk Food|{l}Human food to eat in moderation[r]{l}{i}Healthy Food|{l}Human food of a healthier variety[r]{l}{i}Beverages|{l}Drinks[r]{l}{i}All|{l}All of the above except Ruby

title: Hurray Dwarf's Fate
description: Choose if Hurray Dwarf (one of the NPCs in the Dwarf Cave) is spared or killed when NPC Guillotine is turned on. If you choose to kill the Dwarf, he will say one of a number of different random dialogue options before meeting his untimely fate.

title: Palette Swap
description: Randomizes the colors used for enemies in the generated seed. For example, Imps may be largely pink rather than orange. Note that combining this setting with "Fun Enemy Names" can lead to confusion for newer players both due to the strange names and the fact that enemies could appear looking like other, similar ilk. Be wary before turning all these options on together.

title: Modern Battlefield
description: Changes the appearance of the battle screen, removing most of the bounding boxes so that it more closely resembles the battle screens seen in later installments in the series (from Final Fantasy II NES and beyond).

title: Three Battle Palettes
description:
Changes the behavior of in-battle color palettes to allow sprite edits to use three different palettes instead of the normal two. This is an advanced option that requires the use of external tools such as FFHackster for importing sprites in order to have a noticeable effect.
 Note: While using the "Three Battle Palettes" option, some effects on screen maybe cause unintended side effects during play. These are minor, such as characters struck by Stone changing color in battle as spells are cast, but could be confusing if you're not used to these side effects.

title: Map Character Slot
description: Allows the player to select which character appears on the overworld and in dungeons, based on which character position in the party (leader, second, third, or fourth) is selected. This choice is made before the ROM is randomized and can only be altered, in game, by moving your characters around to the selected slot.

title: Music Shuffle
description:
Adjusts the behavior of background music during play.
 None leaves all tracks in their normal place.
 Standard music shuffle operates only from the pool of dungeon tracks, along with the overworld theme.
 Nonsensical music shuffle mixes every song in the game into one pool, including shorter tunes that can loop very quickly.
 Disable Music mutes all music, although sound effects, and some very short jingles, will still play.

title: Disable Damage Tile Flicker
description: Disables screen flashing when stepping over lava tiles. A useful option if you have a sensitivity to flashing lights or bright colors.

title: Disable Spell Cast Flash
description: Removes the full screen color flash when casting spells. A useful option if you have a sensitivity to flashing lights or bright colors.

title: Menu Color
description:
Changes your menu screen color from the default blue to a selection of other colors.
 This may also be changed in game by pressing Select at the New Game/Continue screen

title: Accessible Spell Names
description:
Updates spell names to make them more accessible. The table below shows what the new names are when this flag is checked:
[grid][r]{i}BM - New|{i}BM - Original|{i}WM - New|{i}WM - Original[r]{l}THUN|{l}LIT|{l}PROT|{l}FOG[r]{l}DOZE|{l}SLEP|{l}DIA|{l}HARM[r]{l}THN2|{l}LIT2|{l}ATHN|{l}ALIT[r]{l}HAST|{l}FAST|{l}DIA2|{l}HRM2[r]{l}DOZ2|{l}SLP2|{l}VOX|{l}AMUT[r]{l}THN3|{l}LIT3|{l}DIA3|{l}HRM3[r]||{l}PRO2|{l}FOG2[r]||{l}DIA4|{l}HRM4[r]||{l}HOLY|{l}FADE

Note: This setting is disabled when "Generate New Spellbooks" is on

title: Shop Information Icons
description: When using Shop Information, elements and statuses are shown as icons, allowing for more information to be displayed.

title: Renounce Autosort
description: Forgo the "Autosort Inventory" flag (found under the Conveniences tab) if it is enabled. This will revert the game to it's standard item menu behavior (Key Items up top, potions at the bottom) no matter what flags are selected.

title: Renounce Chest Info
description: Forgo the "Chest Information" subflag (found under Shop Information) if it is enabled. This will revert to showing only the item name when opening chests.

title: Renounce Cant Hold Red
description: When enabled, displays "Can't Hold" screens in default menu color even when "Chest Information" subflag is enabled.

title: Crop Friendly Screen
description: Gives the Load/New Game and Party Selection a discernible background color to make life easier for restreamers.

title: Slow Down Screen Wipes
description: Opt out of the Convenience flag that speeds up the screen transitions of the game. Reverts screen transitions back a near-vanilla, slow speed.

title: Slow Down Battle Messages
description: Opt out of the Convenience flag that speeds up the message text in battle. Reverts these message windows back to a near-vanilla, slow speed.

title: Slow Down Movement Speed
description: Opt out of the Convenience flag that speeds up characters on maps, both on the overworld and in dungeons. Reverts movement speed back to a near-vanilla, slow speed, although players can still dash if they hold down the B button.

title: Quick Controller 2 Reset
description: Instead of holding Up+A and Up+B on controller 2 for a hard reset and a soft reset, only holding A and B, respectively, is required.

title: Custom Player Sprites
description:
Import custom player sprites. Must use sprite sheets from
http://www.groggy.dog/ffr_sprites/Images/sprites.bmp
Compatible with Fun % flag Three Battle Palettes.
Notes for custom sprites:
1) Use NES colors http://www.groggy.dog/ffr_sprites/Images/NESpalette.png
2) Maximum of three colors per sprite, plus black (for battle sprites) or transparent (magenta, for mapman sprites)
3) Mapman can have separate palettes for head and body
4) All battle sprite postures for a given class must have the same palette
5) Maximum of two (or three with 'Three Battle Palettes' flag) distinct battle palettes across all classes, classes will need to share palettes, and sprites intended to share a palette need to use exactly same colors in the import image.

Import problems (usually palette problems) will be reported on the Javascript console; use your browser's Web Developer Tools to view the messages.
Sprites are saved when you click 'Save Preferences' in the Fun% menu.

title: Free Orbs
description: Starts the game with all four Orbs lit. The KEY and LUTE are still required to reach Chaos, although other settings may change this behavior.

title: Hidden Chaos
description: Chaos is hidden in a random chest and must be found to be defeated. Once you've killed Chaos the game ends. If you find Chaos and then lose, fear not -- the fiend will not move and can be tracked down to the same treasure chest to be fought again.

title: Alternate Final Boss
description:
Changes the Chaos fight to involve one of several enemy formations instead of just Chaos. These formations are:
 Double Dragons: Kary2 and Tiamat2
 FunDead: 2 buffed Lich2s and 4 buffed Phantoms
 WarMECH and Friends: 2 WarMECHs and 6 Evilmen
 Whack-a-Garland: Chaos and 8 Garlands
Sahagin Wagon: Kraken 1, Kraken 2, 2-4 R.Sahags, and 2-4 WzSahags (9 monsters total with Kraken 1 and kraken 2 forced)
Snake Pit: Tiamat 1, Tiamat 2, 1-6 Asps, 1-6 Cobras (9 monsters total with Tiamt 1 and Tiamat 2 forced)

title: Unlocked ToFR
description: Unlocks all locked doors in the Temple of Fiends Revisited, allowing access to Chaos without the need for the KEY.

title: Shorten ToFR
description:
Shortens the Temple of Fiends Revisited to lead straight to Chaos' Floor. By default, the four Orbs are still required to enter the dungeon.
 Note: Both the KEY and the LUTE will be required if this box is checked, unless other settings are selected that change these requirements.

title: Include Fiend Tiles
description: Adds the four Fiend refights to the Chaos floor. Two trap tiles will be found on either side south of the entrance, with the boss in each tile shuffled for each seed.

title: Refight All Fiends
description: Now all four Fiends are in both directions and they must all be defeated to reach CHAOS.

title: Add ToFR Exit
description:
Adds a Warp Portal in ToFR that lets you exit the dungeon, without needing an EXIT or WARP spell.
This flag also works with "Shorten ToFR".

title: Chaos Floor Encounters
description:
Allows enemy encounters to appear on the Chaos floor in the Temple of Fiends Revisited. The list is exclusive to this floor, not simply pulled from another zone, and includes:
- 12/64 - 3-4 Worms
- 12/64 - 3-7 Sorcerers
- 12/64 - 2-4 RockGOLs
- 12/64 1-2 Evilmen and 1-2 Nighmares
- 06/64 1-3 WzVamps and 1-2 ZomDs
- 06/64 1 Phantom
- 03/65 1 GasD
- 01/64 2-3 Mages and 1 Fighter

title: Shard Hunt
description:
Activates Shard Hunt, a mode in which the Light Warriors must acquire a number of orb pieces (which can be called SHARDs, PIECEs, ORBLETs, etc.) in order to open the time gate (the Black Orb) in the Temple of Fiends.
Defeating Fiends and activating the altars for the four standard orbs will, instead or lighting one big orb, grant the player 2 SHARDs for the Earth and Fire orbs (the Lich and Kary fights in the vanilla game) or 4 SHARDs for the Water and Air orbs (the Kraken and Tiamat fights in the vanilla game).
The SHARDs replace generally low-quality items in the treasure pool.

title: Shard Goal
description:
Sets the number of SHARDs the player needs to collect in order to restore the Black Orb and travel into the past to the Temple of Fiends Revisited. Can be set to a fixed amount (i.e., exactly 16 Shards) or a range (i.e., 16-24 Shards).
There will always be exactly 32 Shards in the treasure pool regardless of this setting (so 44 total Shards available including fiend fight rewards).

title: Lich's Revenge - Halloween Special 2020
description:
Lich is having their revenge, unleashing a zombie apocalypse upon the world!
- All NPCs are zombies
- Key NPCs will attack you when giving you their item
- Buffed undead enemies
- Lich is the End Boss

title: Lich's Revenge - Halloween Special 2020
description:
Lich is having their revenge, unleashing a zombie apocalypse upon the world!
- All NPCs are zombies
- Key NPCs will attack you when giving you their item
- Buffed undead enemies
- Lich is the End Boss

title: Price Scaling
description:
Sets the scale of the prices of shop items and the value of gold treasure boxes you find.
An item's price is randomized by: (Original Price) / (Exp & Gold Multiplier) x (Randomly choosen value between min and max percent).
The average cost of an item is (Original Price) / (Exp & Gold Multiplier) x (Average Percent).
Example: Silver Sword, 3.0x Exp & Gold Boost, 20-100%.
4000 / 3 x 0.44 = 586g on average.

title: Wrap Overflowing Prices
description:
If items scale such that their cost is higher than 65,535G (the maximum price an item could have in the vanilla game), this flag will allow those prices to "wrap" back to 1G and continue from there.
For example, when disabled, an item that should cost 67,000G would cost 65,535G. When enabled, that item would cost 1,465G.

title: Starting Gold
description: Set the starting gold.

title: Exclude Gold from Scaling
description: Gold treasures will only roll to ±10% of their vanilla value instead of scaling with prices. Removes the flat gold boost from "Exp. & Gold Boost" to enemy rewards. Also removes the inverse "Exp. & Gold Boost" multiplier to prices.

title: Exclude Gold from Scaling - Cheap Vendor Item
description: Guarantees a less expensive vendor item when excluding gold from scaling.

title: Exclude Gold from Scaling - Apply flat Gold Boost to Enemies
description:
Applies the flat gold boost from "Exp. & Gold Boost" to enemy rewards even though the multiplier will not be.
This, ideally, makes early gold grinds more satisfying.

title: Separate Enemy HP Scaling
description: Uses a second scaling for enemy HP independent of the other scaled stats.

title: Separate Boss HP Scaling
description: Uses a second scaling for boss HP independent of the other scaled stats.

title: Evade Cap
description: Caps the evade of enemies during scaling. When enemies have very high evade it can become near-impossible to hit them; this is especially an issue on Chaos and other endgame bosses.

title: Wrap Overflowing Scaled Stats
description:
Stats that roll above the maximum value in the randomizer will normally remain at the maximum. This flag allows the stats to "wrap" back around to 1 and progress from there.
When disabled, a stat which was scaled to 260 would be 255 where as, when enabled, the stat would be 5.

title: Scaled Stats Includes Morale
description: Includes enemy morale in the stat scaling, as opposed to keeping morale separate (fixed at their vanilla values).

title: Encounter Rates
description:
Sets the odds of seeing random encounters. A 1.00x multiplier is the same chance of encounters as vanilla (which is 8 random encounters out of 256 steps in most dungeons, for example).
"Most dungeons" covers the majority of dungeon areas, but there are some areas which have higher encounter rates: The "Bridge of Destiny" (the final floor of Sky Fortress where you fight Tiamat-1) has triple the rate, and the fiend floors in ToFR are 13-50% higher.

title: Exp/Gold Progressive Scaling
description:
Increases the bonus provided by Exp/Gold boost based on the number of Key Items collected.
When Shards are being used, the boost is applied per Shard - so "50% per 8 Shards" gives you a 6.25% boost for each Shard you have.

title: Nones Gain XP
description: When enabled, "None" characters will count as alive characters for XP calculation and gain their share of XP. If "Tavern Recruitment Mode" and/or "Gated Characters" are also enabled, characters hired over these "None" characters will gain all the EXP (and levels) of the None at that point.

title: Deads Gain XP
description: When enabled, dead characters will count as live characters for XP calculation and gain their share of XP.

title: Experience Chest Conversion
description:
Chests typically containing Gold can be converted into chests that grant EXP.
The slider determines how many Gold chests in the game will be converted into EXP chests.

title: Experience Chest Reward
description: Sets the minimum and maximum amounts of EXP that an EXP Chest can grant when opened.

title: Main NPCs
description: Guarantees all "Main Quest" NPCs will hold an item from your incentive item pool. These NPCs include: the King, Princess Sara, Bikke, the Canoe Sage, Sarda, the Waterfall Cave Robot, and the Caravan Merchant.

title: Fetch Quest NPCs
description: Guarantees all "Fetch Quest" NPCs will hold an item from your incentive pool. Fetch quest NPCs require their respective key items to gain the item they hold. For example, Astos requires the CROWN in order to get his item. Fetch quest NPCs include: Astos, Matoya, the Elf Prince, the Dwarves, the Lefeinish, and the Fairy.

title: Ice Cave Incentive Chest
description:
Incentivizes the FLOATER chest in Ice Cave from the vanilla game.
One random item from your incentive item pool will be guaranteed in this chest, provided the number of incentive items matches or is less than the number of incentive locations.

title: Castle Ordeals Incentive Chest
description:
Incentivizes the TAIL chest in the Castle of Ordeals from the vanilla game.
One random item from your incentive item pool will be guaranteed in this chest, provided the number of incentive items matches or is less than the number of incentive locations.

title: Marsh Cave Incentive Chest
description:
Incentivizes the CROWN chest in Marsh Cave from the vanilla game.
One random item from your incentive item pool will be guaranteed in this chest, provided the number of incentive items matches or is less than the number of incentive locations.

title: Titan’s Trove Incentive Chest
description:
Incentivizes the leftmost chest in Titan’s Trove. Note that if the Titan’s Trove map edit is on, this chest will require the RUBY to access.
One random item from your incentive item pool will be guaranteed in this chest, provided the number of incentive items matches or is less than the number of incentive locations.

title: Earth Cave Incentive Chest
description:
Incentivizes the RUBY chest next to the Vampire in Earth Cave in the vanilla game. The Vampire must be killed to obtain access to this chest.
One random item from your incentive item pool will be guaranteed in this chest, provided the number of incentive items matches or is less than the number of incentive locations.

title: Volcano Incentive Chest
description:
Incentivizes the leftmost chest on KARY’s floor (the "Red D Chest" in the vanilla game). This chest requires the passage of two trap tile encounters to access, so make sure you are prepared before approaching.
One random item from your incentive item pool will be guaranteed in this chest, provided the number of incentive items matches or is less than the number of incentive locations.

title: Sea Shrine Incentive Chest
description:
Incentivizes the SLAB chest on the Mermaids floor on Sea Shrine from the vanilla game.
One random item from your incentive item pool will be guaranteed in this chest, provided the number of incentive items matches or is less than the number of incentive locations.

title: Sky Palace Incentive Chest
description:
Incentivizes the ADAMANT chest (the bottom-left chest on the "Sky Spider" floor) in Sky Palace from the vanilla game.
One random item from your incentive item pool will be guaranteed in this chest, provided the number of incentive items matches or is less than the number of incentive locations.

title: Coneria Castle Incentive Chest
description:
Incentivizes the TNT chest in the Coneria locked treasury from the vanilla game. This chest requires the KEY to access.
One random item from your incentive item pool will be guaranteed in this chest, provided the number of incentive items matches or is less than the number of incentive locations.

title: Marsh KEY Locked Incentive Chest
description:
Incentivizes the bottom right chest of the bottom floor of Marsh Cave. This chest requires the KEY to access.
One random item from your incentive item pool will be guaranteed in this chest, provided the number of incentive items matches or is less than the number of incentive locations.

title: Cardia Incentive Chest
description:
Incentivizes top-right chest in the left-most room of the forest island of the Cardia Islands. The AIRSHIP is required to access, unless combined with the 'Bahamut Cardia dock' and 'Dragon's Hoard' flags.
Note that if incentive placement is set to "random" this item can appear in any of the chests among the populated Cardia islands.
One random item from your incentive item pool will be guaranteed in this chest, provided the number of incentive items matches or is less than the number of incentive locations.

title: Incentive Placement Types
description:
Vanilla - Sets the incentive chest to be the default chest and room (the one shown in the tooltip) for a given location.
Random - Chooses a random chest at the selected location to act as an incentive chest.
Before Gating - Chooses a chest on a floor that comes before gating; e.g. Earth Cave floors 1-3 before the ROD block, Mirage Tower before the CUBE plate, all of Sea Shrine minus the crescent-shaped "TFC" room.
Behind Gating - Chooses a chest on a floor that comes after gating; e.g. Earth Cave Floor 4 after ROD block, Sky Palace after the CUBE plate, Sea Shrine in the crescent-shaped "TFC" room (which requires the KEY to enter).

title: No Loose Items in Incentivized Dungeons
description:
If a dungeon is incentivized, additional loose items and/or unincentivized key items won't be placed inside of it.
This means that once you find the incentivized item, you can opt to leave the incentive area knowing that any remaining loose items will be somewhere else.

title: Main Progression Items
description: Adds the LUTE, KEY, ROD, OXYALE, CHIME and CUBE to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Other Quest Items
description: Adds the CROWN, CRYSTAL, HERB, TNT, RUBY, BOTTLE, SLAB, and ADAMANT to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Floater
description: Adds the FLOATER to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Canoe
description: Adds the CANOE to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Ship & Canal
description: Adds the SHIP and the CANAL to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Tail
description: Adds the TAIL to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Masamune
description: Adds the Masamune to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Xcalber
description: Adds the Xcalber to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Katana
description: Adds the Katana to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Vorpal
description: Adds the Vorpal Sword to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Defense
description: Adds the Defense Sword to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Thor Hammer
description: Adds the Thor Hammer to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Opal Bracelet
description: Adds the Opal Bracelet to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Power Gauntlet
description: Adds the Power Gauntlet to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations. The Power Gauntlet is the Guaranteed Power Item when that flag is enabled

title: Power Staff
description: Adds the Power Staff to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations. The Power Staff is the Guaranteed Defense Item when that flag is enabled.

title: White Shirt
description: Adds the White Shirt to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Black Shirt
description: Adds the Black Shirt to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Ribbon
description: Adds one (1) Ribbon to the incentive pool to be distributed in the selected incentive locations.

title: Hints Givers in Villages
description:
In each town, a villager reveals the location of an item:
- The old men in Coneria, Pravoka, Melmond, and Onrac
- An Elf scholar in Elfland
- Lukahn in Crescent Lake
- The Witch in Gaia
- The villager on the left side of Lefein (no SLAB translation required)

title: Hints Givers in Dungeons
description:
Five NPCs in dungeons each reveal the location of an item. The locations of the NPCs are:
- Down the dead end of Marsh Cave B1
- Lich's floor in Earth Cave
- The hallway of Gurgu Volcano B3
- One of the mermaids in Sea Shrine
- The south room of Sky Palace 3F

title: Useless Hints
description: Half of the hint-giving NPCs will give useless hints instead.

title: Shuffle Entrances
description:
Overworld entrances (except for towns) are shuffled together, such that the entrance to Earth Cave may be at Waterfall, Volcano may be at the Cardia Islands, etc.
This flag must be on for "Floor Shuffle" to be activated.
 "Treasures" and "Main NPC Items" shuffle flags, found in the Treasures tab, must be enabled for this flag to function.

title: Allow Unsafe Start
description:
When shuffling entrances, FFR normally guarantees 4 'safe' entrances amongst Coneria, Coneria Castle, Dwarf Cave, Temple of Fiends, Matoya's Cave, and Pravoka entrances. This flag removes that safety net.
Furthermore, if you enable the "Towns" shuffle flag and "Include Coneria", this flag also removes the guarantee that the Coneria entrance will be a town at all.

title: Include Dead Ends
description: The two empty floors of the Cardia Islands are generally not included in Entrance Shuffle. This flag includes those two floors, and their entrances in the Cardia Islands, into the pool.

title: Shuffle Floors
description: Enables the shuffling of all floors in the game. If floors are not shuffled, each area will be moved together as a single unit, such that Earth B1 leads to Earth B2, etc. If floors are shuffled, Earth B1 may lead to Volcano B3, or Sky 1 could lead to the Waterfall, as just two examples.

title: Deep ToFR
description:
Enables the game to place the first floor of the Temple of Fiends at any level of a dungeon such that multiple floors may have to be crossed to enter the Temple of Fiends.
If this flag is active, the whole of the Temple of Fiends will be shuffled as a single unit, so once you find the Temple of Fiends you don't have to search elsewhere for each floor; it's all right there.

title: Shuffle Towns
description:
Shuffles the town entrances amongst themselves. When town entrances are shuffled, all towns, aside from Coneria, could appear at any other town, such that the town at Pravoka could be Lefein (or vice-versa).
 "Treasures" and "Main NPC Items" shuffle flags, found in the Treasures tab, must be enabled for this flag to function.

title: Include Coneria
description:
This will include Coneria in Town Shuffle. This will make for a potentially more difficult start to the seed.
Unless "Allow Unsafe Start" is enabled, the Coneria entrance will always lead to a town.
Note: Only certain towns (those with Clinics and Item Shops) can appear at the Coneria location; this means only Pravoka, Elfland, Crescent Lake, Onrac, and Gaia. The flag does not take into account Melmondish or Lefeinish Hospitality flags.
Do note that if you turn on "Vampire Attacks Random Town" there's a chance the new town at the Coneria location could be vampire-attacked and, thus, not have a working Item Shop or Clinic.

title: Mix All Entrances Together
description: Mixes all dungeon and town entrances together. When enabled, the entrance to any location, aside from Coneria Town, could lead to any town or dungeon.

title: Deep Towns
description: Towns are generally found at the top entrances of the world. When this flag is enabled, towns (other than Coneria, unless "Include Coneria" is enabled) may be hidden behind dungeon floors, such that Earth B1's staircase may lead to Elfland.

title: Sky Castle 4F
description:
Changes the configuration of the teleporters in Sky Castle's 4th Floor.
Normal: Uses the standard placement of the two teleporters as seen in the vanilla game.
Teleporters: Moves the location of the teleporters to potentially new places on the floor.
Maze: Introduces walls so the party must find a way through the maze to the other teleporter, although the teleporter could be anywhere in the maze and not necessarily at the "end".

title: Castle Ordeals Pillars
description: Shuffle the destinations of the teleport pillars on the second floor of the Castle of Ordeals, leading to a completely new maze to navigate each seed.

title: Titan's Trove
description: Moves the Titan over a square and edits his map slightly so that, even with the AIRSHIP, it is not possible to reach the Titan's treasure boxes without feeding him the RUBY he craves so dearly.

title: Bahamut's Hoard
description:
Places all the Cardia Islands chests in Bahamut's room.
Note: This does not remove the Cardia chests at the other locations. Looting the Hoard chests means the linked chests at the other Cardia locations will be empty, and vice versa.

title: Hall of Dragons
description: Adds encounters to Bahamut B1 hallway normally leading to Bahamut's room. All encounters will be various forms of dragons.

title: Generated Waterfall Cave
description: Randomly generates the map for the Waterfall cave creating a new maze each seed.

title: Flip Dungeons Horizontally
description: At random, dungeon floors are flipped horizontally.

title: Early Open Progression
description: Changes the map to allow walking from Coneria to Dwarf Cave, as well as connecting the Ice Cave and Volcano river systems to allow passage from Pravoka to Crescent Lake with the CANOE.

title: Extended Open Progression
description: Remove the river tile between the Dwarf Cave and Northwest Castle so that section of the overworld can be traversed on foot (without the need for the CANOE).

title: Northern Docks
description: Adds additional docks near Onrac and the Mirage Tower.

title: Ryukahn Desert Dock
description: Adds an additional dock near the Ryukhan desert.

title: Bahamut Cardia Dock
description: Adds a dock to Bahamut's island so that the AIRSHIP is not required for class change.

title: Lefein River Dock
description: Adds a river dock to the Lefein region, making it accessible without the AIRSHIP.

title: Gaia Mountain Pass
description: Adds a mountain pass to Gaia, making it accessible without the AIRSHIP.

title: Early King Item
description: The King of Coneria will give the party his item before the Princess is saved.

title: Early Sarda Item
description: Sarda will give the party his item before the Vampire is killed.

title: Early Sage Item
description: The Sage in Crescent Lake will give his item without requiring the Earth Orb to be lit.

title: Early Ordeals
description: The party may complete the Castle of Ordeals without the CROWN.

title: Zozo Melmond
description:
Includes random battles on the desert tiles inside the town of Melmond, reminiscent of the town of Zozo in Final Fantasy VI.
If "Vampire Attacks Random Town" is turned on, the desert tiles in whatever town the Vampire has singled out for destruction will have potential encounters. Enemies are pulled from the surrounding area for these vampire-attacked towns.

title: Melmondish Hospitality
description:
Adds a clinic to Melmond.
If "Tavern Recruitment Mode" is enabled, Melmond's Clinic will be a Pub instead (based on Crecent Lake's Pub).
This flag works independent of "Vampire Attacks Random Town" such that a new clinic will not be added to other vampire-attacked towns. Meanwhile, if Melmond is "restored" because the vampire went elsewhere, there will only be one clinic, not two.

title: Confused Old Men
description: The circle of sages in Crescent Lake is no longer a circle but, instead, each of the sages will walk around, freed of the shackles that kept them stuck in a circle. Viva la resistance!

title: Add Gaia Shortcut
description: Adds a shortcut in Gaia that connects the L8 Magic Shops, Fairy Spring, and Front Entrance.

title: Move Gaia Item Shop
description:
Moves the Item Shop next to the Gaia Shortcut.
This flag is ignored if "Add Gaia Shortcut" is disabled.

title: Lefeinish Hospitality
description:
Lefein now includes an Inn and Clinic, buildings not normally found in that town.
If "Tavern Recruitment Mode" is enabled, Lefein's Clinic will be a Pub instead.

title: Add Lefein SuperStore
description:
Upgrades the L8 Magic Shops in Lefein to include additional L1-L8 Magic Shops from around the world.
Does not include L7 and L8 Magic Shops from the neighboring town of Gaia.
Note: This flag is ignored if the "Shop Reduction" flag for the Magic Shops is enabled.

title: Shuffle Pravoka's Shop
description: Shops in Pravoka are shuffled amongst all occupied and unoccupied buildings.

title: Vampire Attacks Random Town
description:
Causes the Vampire to attack a random town. The attacked town will not have an Item Shop or Clinic.
Note: The Vampire will not attack the starting town, Coneria, by default.

title: Vampire Attacks Random Town - Include Coneria
description: Allows the Vampire to potentially attack Coneria.

title: Treasures
description: Shuffle all treasures normally available to a random chest. All items are assured to be in a chest somewhere in the game.

title: Randomize Treasures
description:
Randomizes the contents of each chest. Items not normally found in chests may be available, some items may not be found in chests that normally would, and duplicates may exist.

None: Chests' content isn't randomized.
World Wealth: Chests' content is randomized based on the tier of the item. Each setting for random wealth weighs the pool differently.
Deep Dungeon: Chests' content is randomized based on each chest's location.
Random: One of the previous options is selected at random.

title: Random Wealth
description:
Alters the distribution of items:
 Normal is the same number of each tier of item as in the vanilla item pool.
 High removes gold chests for more legendary and rare equipment.
 Melmond has the lowest chance of top tier gear.

title: Deep Dungeon Mode
description:
Sets how randomized items are placed using the Deep Dungeon treasures randomizer.

Progressive: Treasures get progressively better as you progress.
Chaotic: The quality of the treasures are totally random, wherever the chests are.

title: Better Trap Treasure
description: Adjusts treasure chests that require walking over an encounter tile so that they are more likely to have high-tier treasures. More information on the tiers of weapons is available in the "Resources" tab.

title: Earlier Ruby
description: Adjust the RUBY's placement to earlier in the seed to increase the likelihood that negotiating the Titan's Tunnel is required for progression.

title: Main NPC Items
description: Adds the BRIDGE, LUTE, SHIP, ROD, CANOE, CUBE, and BOTTLE to the Key Item shuffle.

title: Fetch Quest Rewards
description: Randomizes the rewards from the fetch quest items. These are the CROWN, CYRSTAL, HERB, TNT, ADAMANT, BOTTLE, and the Lefein item from the SLAB. If left unchecked, each fetch quest is vanilla (i.e., CROWN would lead to CRYSTAL, CRYSTAL would lead to HERB, etc.).

title: Objective NPCs
description:
Shuffles the locations of Dr. Unne, the Elven Doctor, and Bahamut.
Note that the Prince will still be napping in Elfland once you deliver the HERB to the Elven Doctor and you will still need to talk to the Prince after.
Also, the small pool of shuffled NPCs means the NPCs may retain their normal location.

title: Trapped Chests Formations
description:
Selects what formations are inside trapped chests.

 Allocated Formations: All alternate formations (116) are allocated to a random chest. If there's still trapped chests without a formation, a new batch of alternate formations is distributed.

 Random Formations: An alternate formation is randomly selected for each chest, without regard to frequency of a given formation.

 Local Formations: An alternate formation of the local encounter table is selected at random for each trapped chest.

 Vanilla Spikes: A random vanilla spike formation from the current dungeon is selected for each trapped chest.

 Random Fiends: Chests are guarded by a random Fiend.

 Phantom: Chests are guarded by Phantom.

 Random: Select one of the previous options randomly.

title: Trapped Chests Count
description:
Sets the number of chests that will have traps (monsters) in them. Setting the slider to the rightmost position will select a random number of trapped chests.

In game count may slightly differ for some flags combinations.
For best results, use in combination with the sub-flags included in this section.

title: Rare Treasures
description:
Sets whether or not chests containing Rare and Legendary items can be in Trapped Chests:

Never: Rare and Legendary items are never trapped.

Random: Rare and Legendary items may be trapped.

Always: All chests containing Legendary or Rare gears are trapped.

title: Key Items
description:
Sets whether or not chests containing Key Items can be in Trapped Chests:

Never: Key Items are never trapped.

Random: Key Items may be trapped.

Always: All chests containing Key Items are trapped.

title: Shards
description:
Sets whether or not chests containing Shards can be in Trapped Chests:

Never: Shards are never trapped.

Random: Shards may be trapped.

Always: All chests containing Shards are trapped.

title: Exclude Common Treasures
description: Common treasures (common equipment, consumables and GP chests) are never trapped.

title: Exclude Incentivized Items
description: Chests containing Incentivized Items (including Incentivized Gear) will never be trapped.

title: Trapped Chests are Marked
description: Puts an X on chests to warn that they're trapped.

title: Free Ship
description: Bikke's SHIP will appear in Coneria's dock at the start of the game.

title: Free Airship
description: The AIRSHIP rises from the grassy plains in front of Coneria at the start of the game.

title: Free Bridge
description: The BRIDGE linking Coneria to Pravoka and onward is built when the game begins.

title: Free Canal
description: Nerrick's CANAL is already excavated when the game begins.

title: Free Canoe
description: Begin the game well equipped for a proper arm workout as the CANOE will aleady be in your inventory.

title: Free Lute
description: Starts the game with the LUTE already in the party's inventory so they can begin their musical adventure. No bards were harmed in the making of this flag.

title: Free Tail
description: The rat's TAIL, required for promotion, is in your inventory when the game begins. You may want to wash the bag after use.

title: Remove Tail
description:
Remove the rat TAIL from the game. Bahamut is no longer interested in that mummified bit of rodent.
If the "Fight Bahamut" flag is on, removing the TAIL will not prevent class change; it actually makes it easier. By removing the TAIL the only requirement for class change will be fighting Bahamut, no TAIL required.

title: Remove Masamune
description: Removes the legendary sword, the Masamune, from chests, from shops (if elite gear is turned on), and from incentive locations (if the Masamune is incentivized).

title: Remove Xcalber
description: Removes the Xcalber from chests, from shops (if elite gear is turned on), and from the ADAMANT turn in (if fetch quests are vanilla).

title: Remove Floater
description:
Removes the Floater from the game, making it impossible to get the Airship.

Can only be enabled if Nothern Docks is enabled.

Enable Bahamut Cardia dock, Lefein river dock, and Gaia mountain pass map edits to make those areas accessible by Ship.

title: Guaranteed Endgame Masamune
description:
Guarantees the contents of the vanilla Masamune chest will be a Masamune.
This flag does not change the placement of other Masamune(s).

title: Send Masamune Home
description:
Guarantees the contents of the vanilla Masamune chest will be a Masamune AND prevents placement of other Masamune(s) if "Randomize Treasures" is activated.
 This flag is ignored if there is an Incentive Masamune. This flag will not remove Masamunes found in Shops.

title: WarMech, Guardian of Masamune
description: Any chest containing a Masamune is protected by a forced WarMech encounter.

title: Shop Shuffle
description:
Shuffles the contents of Weapon, Armor, and Item shops, changing which shops have what items for sale. PURE and SOFT potions will be available in the Coneria Item Shop under most flagsets (any flags that make it likely you'll face these statuses early, such as Randomized Status Attacks).
 Note that this only shuffles the contents of each shop among like shops around the world -- weapons for weapons, armor for armor, and items among other items. You won't, for instance, find HEAL pots in a Weapon shop or a Silver Bracelet in an Item shop.

title: Random Weapons and Armor
description: Adds various low to mid-tier Weapons and Armor found in the game to the Weapon and Armor Shops (respectively) regardless of whether they are normally sold in shops or found in chests.

title: Include Caster and Elite Gear
description: Adds rare and high level Weapons and Armor found in the game to Weapon and Armor Shops (respectively). These can include normally unique or high-value items such as the Masmune and Ribbons as well as equipment that casts spells when used, such as Black Shirts and Thor Hammers.

title: Magic Shop Shuffle
description:
Shuffles what level spells are available at in each shop. With this checked you will likely find several different levels of magic at each shop regardless of location.
 In essence, this is a flag that will likely make the start of the game harder as, even at Coneria, you could end up with spells from higher levels all mixed together (as shown in the tooltip image). This could potentially block characters from using magic (or even being able to afford it) until much later in the game.

title: Magic Shop Location Shuffle
description:
Shuffles the locations of magic shops, except Coneria (Level 1 magic), so that any town's magic shop could show up anywhere else (i.e., Pravoka's magic shop could be in Melmond).
 Note: Magic shops are not coupled together, so if you use this flag you could end up with a Level 3 Black Magic Shop and a Level 6 White Magic Shop at Pravoka, or four different levels of shops at Elfland.

title: Paired Shuffle
description: When shuffling the locations of magic shops, they are moved in pairs so spells of a certain level are found together (i.e., both Level 6 Magic shops could move to Pravoka, or both Level 2 and both Level 7 could move to Elfland).

title: Legendary Shops
description:
Creates up to five legendary shops in dungeons, one of each type.
The potential locations are: Earth Cave B2, Marsh Cave B2, Dwarves' Cave, Mirage Tower F1, Ice Cave B1, Left Sea Shrine 2

title: Exclusive Legendary Weapon Shop
description: Removes weapons found in the Legendary Weapon Shop from all other shops and treasure chests found in the world.

title: Exclusive Legendary Armor Shop
description: Removes armor found in the Legendary Armor Shop from all other shops and treasure chests found in the world.

title: Exclusive Legendary Black Magic Shop
description: Removes Black Magic found in the Legendary Black Magic Shop from all other shops found in the world.

title: Exclusive Legendary White Magic Shop
description: Removes White Magic found in the Legendary White Magic Shop from all other shops found in the world.

title: Exclusive Legendary Item Shop
description: Removes items found in the Legendary Item Shop from all other shops and treasure chests found in the world.

title: Magic Levels
description:
Shuffles the levels of spells, but not what level is sold, at each magic shop.
Unless "Keep Permissions" is checked, the ability of a character to learn a given spell depends on whether or not a class can learn the spell originally in that spell's new slot (so make sure you know the vanilla spell slots for your characters).

title: Tiered Shuffle
description:
Shuffles the magic across spell levels, but with a weight given to certain spells at certain levels.
You are more likely to find levels 1 through 3 magic in the levels 1 through 3 stores, with those spells given a 60% chance to show up there (versus 30% for levels 4 through 6 and 10% for levels 7 and 8).
At levels 4 through 6, those spells are 40% likely to show up (versus 30% for levels 1 through 3, and 30% for 7 and 8).
Finally, for levels 7 and 8 shop, those levels are 60% likely to show up in the shops (versus 10% for levels 1 through 3, and 30% for levels 4 through 6).

title: Mix Spellbooks
description: Mixes the standard White and Black spellbooks together, allowing for White Magic to show up in Black Magic shops (and be usable by Black Mages/Wizards) and vice versa for Black Magic and White Shops/Casters.

title: Keep Permissions
description: Forces spells to keep the class permissions from the unrandomized game, no matter what slot they are in or level of magic they are currently listed at. Thus, with "Keep Permissions" on, even if NUKE shows up at level one, your Black Mage wouldn't be able to learn the spell until after promotion (as the spell was promotion locked, at Level 8, in the vanilla game).

title: Improve Curative Spells
description: Improves the efficacy of CURE, CUR2, CUR3, HEAL, HEL2, HEL3, LAMP, and AMUT spells. CURE spells now restore twice as much health and HEAL spells restore 33% more. LAMP and AMUT now also cure paralysis effects.

title: Improve Tier-1 Damage Spells
description: Makes HARM single-target, and improves the efficacy of the FIRE, ICE, LIT, and HARM spells to have equivalent power to their Tier-3 counterparts (e.g. HARM now does as much damage as HRM3, but to a single target).

title: Set Lock Hit Mode
description: Allows control over the chance to hit when casting LOCK and LOK2 spells. Vanilla is about a 7% chance to hit vs Chaos; 107 is about 28%; 162 is about 56%. Auto-hit will always hit (100%).

title: Power Word HP Limit
description:
Changes the threshold at which BLND, STUN, and XXXX are effective, both against enemies and the heroes.
The value, as selected in the dropdown, will always be a multiple of 300, or unlimited, but you can set it to randomly select, before the ROM is generated, which option will be used in the game.

title: Generate New Spellbooks (Spellcrafter)
description:
Randomly generates completely new white and black magic spell books, replacing all magic in the game with this new selection of spells. Some spells may have the same names (i.e., FIRE, ICE, WARP, TMPR) while others will be completely new spells not seen before in the vanilla version of Final Fantasy (i.e., ROCK, SNOW, VOLT, etc.).
 Note: Spellcrafter will also change the default slots characters can learn spells, in effect reducing the number of spells, and spell slots, the Knight, Ninja, and Red Mage can learn.

title: Retain Old Permissions (Spellcrafter)
description: When enabled, Spellcrafter will not overwrite the game's original spell permissions, so characters will learn the spells in their default, vanilla slots, even with Spellcrafter enabled (i.e., Red Mages will learn the first and third slot in Level 1 White Magic and Level 3 Magic, all White Magic at Level 2, everything in the first four levels of Black Magic, etc.).

title: Mix Spellbooks (Spellcrafter)
description: Mixes the randomly generated spells created by Spellcrafter. Spells that would typically be considered White Magic may be classed as Black Magic and vice-versa, allowing those casters a greater variety of spells, potentially.

title: Spell Name Obfuscation
description:
Hides the actual spell names for all spells:

Mixed Up: Shuffles spell names.

Madness: Creates random codewords.

title: Shop Reduction
description:
Reduces the number of Items/Magic sold in Shops, or removes Shops entirely.
Modes:
None - Do not remove anything
Whole Shops - Removes the specified amount of shops as a whole
All Items of a Kind - Selects the specified amount of distinct Items and removes all instances of them (e.g. all Heals)
Spread - Applies the reduction for each shop individually (e.g. each shop gets a 40% reduction)
Unequal - Removes the amount from all entries (e.g. some shops will be full, some might be half full, some might be removed)

title: Enemy Formation Shuffle Mode
description:
Shuffles the encounters that appear in enemy domains.
Vanilla: Enemy groups remain as they exist in the original game. This allows players to predict encounters in a dungeon if they know the vanilla values.
 Shuffle Rarity: Enemy groups are shuffled within a zone, so that Group 1 (common) fights can appear as Group 6 (uncommon), etc. This removes the ability to 'scout' the encounter table and know which fights will appear in advance.
Tiered Rarity Shuffle: Enemy formations will shuffle within their encounter groups based on their original rarity. (1-4 will tend to be lower in rarity, 5-6 can sometimes be lower in rarity, 7-8 will rarely be lower in rarity.)
Shuffle Across Zones: Shuffles ALL encounters, so that any encounter can appear anywhere regardless of zone or rarity. The overworld between Coneria and ToF is still guaranteed to have earlier enemies (e.g. BONE, WOLF, GrIMP).
 Totally Random: Populates the encounter table entirely at random (excepting fiends, plot-triggered encounters, and empty encounters). This means specific formations can be added multiple times, and that "B-side" formations that aren't used in vanilla can appear as well. The overworld between Coneria and ToF is still guaranteed to have earlier enemies (e.g. BONE, WOLF, GrIMP).
 Note: This feature is disabled when generating new enemy formations (via Enemizer).

title: Unrunnable Formations
description:
Changes whether the party can run from certain packs or not. Note that this does not change bosses, which under this flag remain unrunnable.
 Normal: Vanilla unrunnable formations. If it's unrunnable in the original game, it remains unrunnable here.
 Shuffle: Shuffles what formations are and are not runnable. Bosses and some other encounters will remain unrunnable.
 All Unrunnable: Disables the ability to run from fights.

All Runnable: Makes all encounters runnable (except for bosses).
 Random Choice: Select one of these options randomly.

title: First Strike and Surprise Possible when Unrunnable
description: Allows you to first strike an unrunnable formation. Also allows an unrunnable formation to ambush YOU.

title: Enemy Surprise Bonus
description: Shuffles the surprise bonus for enemy formations, changing which groups will (almost) always ambush you.

title: Boss Scripts
description: Shuffles the spells and skills (if any) each bosses uses. The original Fiends are shuffled between themselves, then the second Fiends, WarMech and Chaos.

title: Boss Skills/Spells
description: Shuffles bosses' skills and spells so they can appear in any script. The original Fiends are shuffled between themselves, then the second Fiends, WarMech and Chaos.

title: Enemy Scripts
description: Shuffles the spells and skills (if any) each monster uses, allowing any enemy to have any other's combat logic.

title: Enemy Skills/Spells
description: Shuffles enemy skills and spells so they can appear in any script. This include only all random encounters.

title: Generate Balanced Scripts
description: Balances skill shuffles among the enemies so that earlier enemies will only have potential access to earlier skills while later enemies are more likely to get the later, more dangerous, skills.

title: Status Attacks Mode
description:
Sets the status ailments each enemy can inflict when they use physical attacks.
Standard: Enemies keep their standard touch attack.
Shuffle: Shuffle the existing touch attacks amongst all enemies.
Randomize: Assign randomly selected touch attacks to enemies.
Random: Select one of the previous options at random.

title: Status Attacks Pool
description:
Sets what status ailment can be inflicted when randomizing status attacks.
All: All possible status, including silence, death and stone.
All except Stun Status: All possible status, except stun ailment.
Only Death Status: Only the Death ailment can be assigned.
Random: Select one of the previous options at random.

title: Include Bosses
description: Bosses are included when shuffling/randomizing status attacks. Bosses are the Fiends, WarMech and Chaos.

title: Remove Trap Tiles
description: Removes all the forced encounter tiles from the game, except the Fiend refights.

title: Shuffle Trap Tiles
description: Shuffles all the forced encounter tiles in the game, except the Fiend refights. This doesn't add in any new tiles, instead it simply shuffles the existing encounter tiles among themselves.

title: Use Alternate Formations
description: Adds several formations into the shuffle pool for the forced encounter tiles, including formations that are not available in the original game.

title: WarMECH Mode
description:
Changes the way WarMECH can be found, and interacted with, in the game.
 Vanilla: WarMECH may appear on Sky Castle 5F, as in the original game.
 Patrolling: A WarMECH sprite will appear wandering on Sky Castle 4F (the floor before the Tiamat-1 fight). Talking to WarMECH starts an unrunnable battle.
 Required: A WarMECH sprite will guard Tiamat's room. You must defeat it before you can fight the actual boss. If WarMECH is Required or Patrolling, it will not appear anywhere else.
 Unleashed: WarMECH appears as a Group 7 formation (3/64 encounters) in ALL zones, including the overworld.

title: Buff the Pirates
description: Increases the stats of Bikke's pirates considerably, roughly equivalent to a level 6 Fighter with a cheap but decent sword and iron armor, and increases the XP and gold yield from them by a factor of 20. This is done before stat scaling, and also increases the level of scripts they can carry when using the "Generate Balanced Scripts" flag if "Allow Unsafe Pirates" is on.

title: Unsafe Pirates
description: Allows Pirates to use shuffled skills and spells and received a status attack. Left unchecked, Pirates will always have a script that directs them to only attack and will never cause a status ailment on attack.

title: Shuffle Astos
description:
Astos is disguised as a quest NPC: Bahamut, Canoe Sage, CubeBot, Elf Doctor, Elf Prince, Fairy, Lefein, Matoya, Nerrick, Sarda, Smith, Titan, Unne or the kindly old king from Northwest Castle.
Unless he is picked by Astos shuffle, the kindly old king in the Northwest Castle will not fight you.

title: Shuffle the Original Fiend Fights
description: Shuffles which Fiend is guarding which orb in the present day. For example, the Fiend at the bottom of Earth Cave could be Tiamat.

title: Alternate Fiends
description: Replace all four Fiends with new Fiends, from a pool of about 20, each with their own weaknesses and skills/spells lists.

title: Fight Bahamut
description:
Turning in the TAIL is not the only requirement for class change; you must also defeat Bahamut to prove your courage.
If "Remove Tail" is enabled, the only requirement for class change is to defeat Bahamut.
Note: This flag is ignored when "Enemizer" or "Lich's Revenge" is enabled.

title: Fight Bahamut - Buffed Bahamut
description:
Increases the stats of Bahamut, roughly to the equivalent of Tiamat. Buffed Bahamut may be given skills, increased critical hit rate, and/or increased number of hits.
Also grants a larger XP yield, roughly half that of WarMECH.

title: Temple of Fiends Bats Text
description:
The dialogue for the Sky Warrior bats in Garland's room can be replaced with spoilers about Chaos and the Fiend refights that will appear in the Temple of Fiends Revisited.
Vanilla - Bats have story dialogue after all four Orbs are lit, as in the vanilla game.
Hints - Describes the ToFR boss stats using text. Adjectives used represent increasing order of difficulty: pretty, extra, very, super, incredibly, insanely.
Stars - Rates each ToFR boss stat on a scale of 1-10.
Full Stats - Gives the numerical stats and full spell and skill scripts for each ToFR boss.

title: Temple of Fiends Bats Text - Early Spoilers
description: Spoiler information can be obtained from the Sky Warrior bats at any time, without needing to light the four Orbs first.

title: Generate New Formations (Enemizer)
description: When enabled, Enemizer uses the pre-existing monsters in the game and mixes them up, generating entirely new formations of enemies not traditionally seen in the game. On its own it does not create new enemies, just new formations.

title: Generate New Enemies (Enemizer)
description:
When enabled, this flag will generate an entirely new set of enemies to populate the entire world. Although the basic sprites will remain the same (as the game has to use the original assets), and they will (generally) retain something of their original names, these will be new enemies with all their appropriate stats scaled to the zone you're exploring. 
As an example, you could leave Coneria and find level 1 MECHs waiting for you in the forest, G.CRABs lurking on the ocean, or BEASTs out on the plains.

title: Allowed Starting Classes
description:
Select which character classes can be chosen at the start of the game, from both regular and promoted classes. The four character slots can be restricted individually, or all together with the "All" row.
"Forced" means that slot will be randomly chosen from the selected possibilities and then locked so you cannot change it. "None" means that slot can have a blank spot with no light warrior. Forced + None together means if None is randomly selected, that slot will be locked to having no light warrior.

title: Party Draft
description: Draft your party from a pool of random characters. The pool is populated with classes from "Allowed Starting Classes", with duplicate classes possible. Once a character is selected, it's removed from the pool. Cancelling your choice puts the character back in the pool.

title: Pool Size
description: Allows you to set the total number of characters in the Party Draft pool.

title: Safe Party Draft
description: Guarantee 1 melee class and 2 distinct mage classes in the pool.

title: Tavern Recruitment Mode
description: Replaces the Clinics found in towns with Pubs. These pubs allow the party to recruit a Light Warrior of a random class, in addition to the standard Clinic duties of reviving fallen Light Warriors.

title: Disable Reviving at Taverns
description:
Disables the ability to revive Light Warriors at the Pub.
When enabled, fallen Light Warriors may only be revived with the LIFE or LIF2 spells, or replaced by the class sold by the Pub.

title: Only Replace Nones at Taverns
description: Limit hiring to only replace "None" characters. This means once you chose a party member for that spot you are stuck with them.

title: Recruitable Adventurer Classes
description: Select the possible classes available to recruit. Applies to both Tavern Recruitement and NPC Recruits.

title: Recruits Gated by Fiends
description: A new character (from a random class) is behind each Fiend. When talked to, that character replaces the selected party member. Push B at the selection screen to cancel taking the gated character.

title: Forced Characters
description: The recruitable character is placed in front of the Elemental Orb altar, forcing the party to pick up the new character before they can officially light the orb.

title: Recruits Linked to Key NPCs
description:
A new character (from a random class) is linked to a key NPC. If that key NPC requirement is fulfilled, the linked character replaces the selected party member. Push B at the selection screen to cancel taking the gated character.
Possible key NPCs: Princess Sara, Matoya, Bikke, King of the Northwest Castle, Elf Prince, Smith, Nerrick, Dr. Unne, Sarda, Canoe Sage, Fairy, Lefeinish Man.

title: Allow Duplicate Recruits
description: Normally, Recruits will have unique classes, unless they are forced to repeat (because Recruit Count is higher than the available classes); this flag removes that restriction.  All selected classes are not guaranteed to be in the pool and a class may not necessarily be available at all in a given seed.

title: Promoted Classes
description: All gated characters will be from the promoted classes in the game.

title: Halve BB Crit Rate
description: Halves the Black Belt's unarmed critical hit rate, so that it is now equal to their current level. (Vanilla crit rate is equal to the character's level times 2.)

title: Thief Hit Rate Rebalance
description: Increases the hit rate of Thieves and Ninjas from +2 per level to +4 per level, making them more effective combatants (helping to balance them in comparison to Fighters and Knights).

title: Thief Agility Buff
description:
Improve the thief/ninja starting agility and starting evade, and make it so that they gain agility and evade on every level. This makes the Thief more likely to evade melee attacks from monsters.
When the Thief is in the lead slot, this also increases the chance of getting first strike and reduces the chance of being surprised.

title: Raise Hit % Cap
description: Changes the max hit percent (Hit %) from 200 to 250, allowing for an extra hit that can be gained when the stat is maxed.

title: MDef Growth Rebalancing
description:
Changes how much MDef is gained at each level up.
BB/Master +3/+4: This changes the BB to gain +3 MDef instead of +4 per level, and the Master +4 instead of +1 per level (+4/+1 is the vanilla behavior, which discourages promotion of Black Belts). With this setting, MDef growth would be:
Fi = 3, Ki = 3, Th = 2 Ni = 2, BB = 3, Ma = 4, RM = 2, RW = 2, WM = 2, WW = 2, BM = 2, BW = 2
Invert All: This takes the MDef growth of all promoted and unpromoted classes and sets them to: 5 - original MDef. With this setting, MDef growth would be:
Fi = 2, Ki= 2, Th = 3, Ni = 3, BB = 1, Ma = 4, RM = 3, RW = 4, WM = 3, WW = 3, BM = 3, BW = 3

title: Blursed Classes
description:
"Blursed" Classes (as in classes with "blessings" and "curses") give bonuses and maluses at random to each of the selectable classes in the game.
Press Select at the Party Selection screen (and A at Status Screen) to reveal the modifiers applied to a given class.

title: Add Spellcasting Bonuses
description: Add bonuses granting spellcasting abilities.

title: Chaos Mode
description: Instead of simply applying "basic" blessings and curses to classes, Chaos Mode shuffles all the stats, spellcasting abilities, and equipment permissions between all the classes, making for very different classes from the vanilla game. Only for experienced players that are comfortable with Blursed Classes in general.

title: Blursed Classes - Natural Resists
description: Adds a set of bonuses that can give classes natural resistances to spell types. S = Status, P = Poison, T = Time, D = Death, F = Fire, I = Ice, L = Lightning, E = Earth.

title: Blursed Classes - XP Bonus
description: Adds a set of bonuses that can give classes more xp gain than others. This bonus is multiplicative with the flagset's exp multiplier.

title: Class Xp Bonus
description:
Gives the selected class a multiplier to exp. This bonus is multiplicative with the flagset's exp multiplier.

e.g. A Flagset bonus XP of 2.0x and a class bonus of 1.5x will have a total of 3.0x for that class.

title: Blursed Classes - Start with Key Items
description: Each Classes will start with a different Key Item. Free or Removed Key Items aren't included. If Thief Lockpicking is enabled, KEY will be excluded. These Key Items are never included: BRIDGE, SHIP, CANAL, CANOE, FLOATER.

title: Random Promotions
description: When giving the TAIL to Bahamut, the wise dragon will promote your party to various, random classes. Random classes are pre-selected by the randomizer when the seed is generated. You will not know ahead of time what that promoted class will be.

title: Include Base Classes
description: Base classes can now be in the possible promotion pool when returning the TAIL to Bahamut.

title: Spoil Promotions
description:
The names of the various classes with be changed to show what classes they will become after promotions.
Format: Current Class - Promotion Class

title: Gain Spell Charges With Max MP Gain
description:
When a character gains Max MP, they also gain a current MP in that spell slot. 

This can be enabled for all classes, only for classes once they promote, or only for classes that receive the 'Max+MP+' class blessing (which will only show up when this option is set to blessed classes).

title: Earlier High-Tier Magic Charges
description:
Charges for Tier 5-8 spells are progressively gained at earlier levels for all Mages; Tier 7-8 charges are still somewhat limited.

Progression still follows a logical pattern similar to vanilla and no spell charges are gained later than vanilla. A few lower-tier charges are also gained earlier to ensure you always gain at least one charge on every level up. White/Black Mages now get full charges at Level 45 and Red Mages now get full charges at Level 50.

description: Allows control over the maximum spell charges per spell level for each spellcasting class in the game. This does not change when they receive new spell levels (as that's tied to experience level). A value of less than 2 will not reduce the starting Level 1 charges of Red, white, and Black mages.

description: Sets the Knight and Ninja magic charge growth to give a charge in all levels whenever those classes gain a charge in any level, giving Knight and Ninja tier 4-8 charges. This alleviates an issue with "Keep Permissions" where the Knight and Ninja could never cast spells they could learn, but is useless otherwise.

title: Starting Equipment - Heal Staff
description: Places a Heal Staff (or any low level Heal casting weapon, or a Heal Helment if nothing else is found in the game) into the party's starting inventory.

title: Starting Equipment - Dragonslayer
description:
Places the Dragon Armor and the Dragon Sword into the party's starting inventory.
Incompatible with Weaponizer.

title: Starting Equipment - Legendary Kit
description:
Places the Xcalber, Opal Armor, Opal Gauntlets, Opal Helm, and Opal Shield into the party's starting inventory.
Incompatible with Weaponizer.

title: Starting Equipment - Grandpa's Secret Stash
description: Adds three legendary tier items and five common tier tiems to the party's starting inventory.

title: Starting Equipment - Random Commons
description: Fills up the party's entire inventory with random equipment. There is a small chance to roll rare and legendary items into this mix of gear.

title: Starting Equipment - Random Type Weapon
description: Adds a random weapon that will have a bonus vs. some weakness (e.g. Rune Sword, Flame Sword, Light Axe, etc) into the party's starting inventory. The Xcal is not in this pool of potential gear.

title: Starting Equipment - Random Starter Pack
description:
Adds four random shop-purchasable body armors and four random common tier weapons into the party's starting inventory.

One Armor will be added from a pool of armor that a fighter can wear, one armor from the red mage pool, then the last two (2) armors will be equippable by mages. Armor selection is weighted and will tend more towards cheaper armors.

title: Starting Equipment - No Legendary Duplicates
description: Prevents receiving more than one of the same Rare/Legendary item in your starting equipment when selecting options that have potential for duplicates.

title: Starting Equipment - Remove Items from Treasure Chests
description:
For every rare or legendary starting equipment received an identical item potentially found in a chest will be replaced with something worse.
Example: Starting the game with a Zeus Gauntlet means a Zeus Gauntlet chest in the world is altered to contain a Silver Gauntlet.

title: Random Weapon Bonus
description:
Gives each weapon a random numerical modification from a selected range. This will increase or decrease (if negative) its:
- Damage by 2 per point
- Hit by 3 (max 50%) per point
- Crit by 3 (1.5%) per point
Values cannot go below zero (0) Hit or one (1) Crit/Damage.

title: Random Weapon Bonus - Exclude Masa
description: Masmune will not receive any bonuses or minuses; it will always be the regular, vanilla Masamune.

title: Random Armor Bonus
description: Gives each armor a random numerical modification from a selected range. This will increase or decrease (if negative) its Absorb by 1 per point (2 points for body armor) and reduce (or increase if the modification is a negative number) its Weight penalty by 1 per point (2 points for body armor).

title: Double Weapon Crit Rate
description: Doubles the crit rate of all weapons, making them more effective and balancing weapon wielders in comparison to Black Belts and their unarmed attacks.

title: Weapon Attack Bonuses
description: Increases elemental and "type" bonuses to weapons, improving the damage bonus from +4 (vanilla behavior) to +X (based on the slider). Default setting is +10.

title: House Full HP Restoration
description: Houses completely restore the party's HP. Unchecked, using a HOUSE restores 120HP to each Light Warrior (the vanilla behavior).

title: Clinics Heal All Statuses
description: In addition to reviving dead characters at 1 HP, all clinics now heal Poison and Stone statuses (without affecting your HP).

title: Clinics don't cost money
description: All clinics revive your characters for free.

title: Turn Shelters into Ethers
description:
Tents, Cabins, and Houses become ethers. Instead of restoring HP and saving on the overworld, they restore MP and can be used anywhere.
Ethers (ETHR) restore a charge for L1-L2. Dry Ethers (DRY) restore a charge for L1-L4. X Ethers (XETH) restore a charge for L1-L8.
Incompatible with the "House MP Restoration" bug fix flag.

title: New Consumables in Shops
description: The new Consumables appear in item shops. Replaces two (2) HEAL pot location, a PURE pot location, and a SOFT pot location with the new consumables.

title: New Consumables in Legendary Shop
description:
The new Consumables can appear in legendary item shop. The legendary item shop will have 1-2 random new consumables.
Requires the Legendary Item Shop flag to be set, in the Shops & Magic Tab.

title: Guaranteed Defense Item
description: Guarantees that the Power Staff has RUSE/INV/INV2 depending on the setting. The item will be treated as a Key Item during placement.

title: Guaranteed Power Item
description: Guarantees that the Power Gauntlet has SABR/TMPR/FAST depending on the setting. The item will be treated as a Key Item during placement.

title: Item Magic Shuffle
description:
This flag shuffles what spell is cast when using any of the castable items (Power Gauntlet, Bane Sword, etc.).
 The spell name will replace the name of the item for clarity, although icons will remain the same (or absent in the case of the Defense sword). Items that use the same icon cannot be differentiated except by equipping (i.e., White Shirt and Black Shirt).
Note: Spell effects do not change the innate magic defense bonuses of the items (i.e., Black Shirt will still provide protection from ICE and TIME elements, even if it becomes the AMUT Shirt).

title: Balanced Shuffle
description:
Remove all of the most powerful spells from the potential spell pool of Item Magic.
 For example, this removes the potential for a NUKE Axe.
 To accommodate Spellcrafter mode, the heuristics that determine what is not allowed are very complex. Basically, almost nothing better than the vanilla buff and debuff magic is possible, nor are damage spells better than the vanilla level 3 versions for each element. The purpose of this flag is therefore to avoid otherwise challenging seeds that are trivialized by the presence of overpowered caster items.

title: All Weapons Cast Spells
description: ALL weapons can cast spells based on the Item Magic Pool, instead of only equipment that normally casts spells.

title: Use Weaponizer
description:
Generate random weapons. Names are assigned based on casting, bonus vs certain monster types or elemental weaknesses, or quality. Use 'select' button on the equip or shop screen to view exact stats. There is a 50% chance of a rare weapon being promotion locked. Legendary weapons have vanilla class restrictions.

description: Common (shop) weapons can have spells or bonuses vs monster types or elemental weaknesses.
