description: Weaponizer does not name weapons for their bonuses vs monster types or elemental weaknesses, only quality or spell casting.

title: House MP Restoration
description: Fixes a bug where the party's MP was restored only after the game was saved.

title: Weapon Stats
description: Fixes applying elemental and "type" bonuses to weapons. These bonuses did not work as intended in the vanilla game, but function properly here for all relevant gear.

title: Chance to Run
description:
Changes the way the chance to run is calculated.
Bugged: Run chance is calculated from a glitched stat as it was programmed in the original NES release.
Corrected: Run chance is calculated from the intended stat, Luck. This greatly improves the effectiveness of the RUN command, as well as classes with high Luck stats, such as the Thief.
 Percentages: Run chance is the selected static value for all classes. This causes no specific class to be any better or worse at running away because their chance to run is the same.

title: Spell Fixes
description: Fixes multiple bugs in various spells, such as TMPR, SABR, and HEL2, so that they provide their proper effect (as opposed to not working, or even in some cases providing an opposite effect from what was intended, as in the vanilla game). Also provides the opportunity to cancel out of casting WARP or EXIT.

title: Enemy Status Attacks
description: Fixes a bug where enemies had a chance to apply a status ailment on attacks that missed once the first attack connected. When enabled, only enemy hits that connect have a chance to inflict status effects (so no more getting killed by 12 hits of Death Touch when all of them miss, unlike in the vanilla game).

title: Bl. Belt & Master Absorb Calculation
description: Fixes a bug in the way the Black Belts' & Masters' Absorb stat is calculated. Unchecked, Absorb is set to the Light Warrior's level so long as the character does not have a weapon equiped (instead of using their armor). Enabled, the absorb is applied only when the Light Warrior does not have any armor equipped, the intended behavior.

title: Enemy Elemental Resistances
description: Fixes a bug where XFER and other spells that affect elemental resistances would not work for enemies.

title: Enemy Spells Targeting Allies
description: Fixes a bug in the way spells are applied when an enemy casts AoE (area of effect) spells on all allies. Unchecked, spells, such as INV2, will skip the enemy that cast the spell. Checked, the spell will (correctly) affect all enemies in the group, including the caster.

title: Improve Turn Order Randomization
description: Improves the balance of turn randomization. Unchecked, the turn order is weighted in favor of the enemies. Enabled, turn order is more balanced.

title: RNG Tables
description: Shuffles the RNG Table and the Battle RNG, changing encounters and the distance between encounters while leaving overall probabilites unchanged.

title: Fix Missing Battle RNG Entry
description: The vanilla Battle RNG table has two 0x00s out of 256 hex values. If checked, this flag replaces one of them with 0x95, the missing hex value. In essence, this takes some spells and effects and reduces the likelihood of them occuring (so the famous 3 in 256 chance to critical hit with spells becomes a 2 in 256 chance).

title: Disable Tent/Cabin/House Saving on Overworld
description: When enabled, using a TENT, CABIN, or HOUSE will only restore HP/MP and not save the game.

title: Disable Inn Saving
description: When enabled, staying at an inn will only restore HP/MP, but not save the game.

title: Save Game When Game Over
description: When enabled, if your party perishes, you will respawn with all of your progression (items acquired, levels gained, etc.) intact. If you have the SHIP (but not the airship), you will respawn where you last docked; if you have the AIRSHIP, you will respawn at the airship and the ship will be waiting for you at Coneria; if you have neither, you will respawn where you last saved.

title: Dragon Warrior Mode
description: Always respawn at Coneria (the Ship and Airship will wait for you there if you have them). Gold is halved.

title: No Party Shuffle
description: If enabled, the player's party is not automatically rearranged when afflicted with status ailments or slain.

title: Speed Hacks
description: If enabled, many game processes such as area transitions, opening the menu, and battle animations are significantly faster.

title: Faster Ship
description: Double the speed of the Ship, so it is the same speed as the Airship.

title: Identify Treasures
description: If enabled, the player can see what item is in a chest if their inventory is full, instead of seeing "Can't hold any more".

title: Faster Walking Speed
description: If enabled, the player's movement speed on foot is doubled. Hold B while walking to reduce to normal speed.

title: Buy Quantity
description:
If enabled, the player has the option to select the quantity of items bought in the item shop.
Press left to reduce quantity by 1, right to increase quantity by 1, up to increase quantity by 10, and down to decrease quantity by 10.

title: WAIT When Unrunnable
description: If enabled, the player is notified when it is impossible to escape a battle by replacing the RUN command with WAIT.

title: Critical Hit Count Display
description:
If enabled, critical hits note how many hits out of the maximum connected with a critical.
For example: 2 critical hits out of 3, instead of simply marking that there was a critical.

title: Battle Magic Menu Wrap Around
description: If enabled, allows the player to "wrap" up and down in the battle magic menu, making navigating to the upper level magic much faster in combat.

title: NPC Guillotine
description:
Talking to certain NPCs removes them from the map when their dialog is dismissed. This can be used to make bats go away, for example.
Only works on NPCs that have a single line of dialogue in the game. For instance, the townspeople of Pravoka will say different things before and after you fight Bikke and his pirate squad, so these NPCs cannot be "swatted".

title: Autosort Inventory
description:
If enabled, HEAL, PURE, and SOFT potions are automatically moved to the first row of the item menu, followed by saving items (TENTs, CABINs, and HOUSEs) on the second row, then all other key items in your inventory.
Note: if "New Consumables" is on, these consumable items will be placed in the third row, with Key Items flowing after.

title: Shop Information
description:
In shops, characters will strike their victory pose if they can equip a piece of equipment or learn a spell.
Press Select to show a description of an item or a spell.

title: Chest Information
description: Shows a description of weapons and armors when opening chests.

title: Gear Incentive Chest Items Fanfare
description: Gear in treasure chests that is marked as incentivized will play the fanfare that is usually played when you obtain a Key Item. In the event a ribbon or katana is incentivized, the fanfare will only play for the one item that was incentivized.

title: Sanity Checker V2
description: Alternative item placement engine that allows the randomizer to accept more complex map changes.

title: Game Mode
description:
Select the type of gameplay.

Standard: Normal game mode where you explore the world, dive dungeons and prepare for your fight againt Chaos.
Deep Dungeon: Turns Coneria Castle into a 52-floor completely procedurally generated dungeon. As you go deeper, the monster encounters get stronger and every so often there will be a branch to the next town, but dying or restoring a save will return you to the overworld. Somewhere within the dungeon is a TAIL and Bahamut.
No Overworld: Removes the overworld from the game entirely; towns and dungeons are connected directly by stairs and warps. The FLOATER and the CANOE are replaced respectively by the SIGIL and Lukahn's MARK.

title: Overworld Map
description:
Select the layout of Overworld.
Vanilla: The original Final Fantasy 1 Overworld.
Generate New Overworld: Creates a completely new overworld, vanilla access requirements (game is beatable even vanilla progression/no treasure shuffle). Map generation is resource intensive and may take 30-60 seconds during which time your browser may be unresponsive. If a seed fails to generate a map, try a different seed, or select Use Pregenerated Map.
Lost Woods: Randomly generated endless forest map.
Desert of Death: Randomly generated deadly desert map.
Import custom map: Import a map using the 'Import map' button.

title: Use Pregenerated Map
description: Use one of the 256 pregenerated maps for a quicker and error free access to the generated new overworld experience.

title: Shuffled Access
description: Locations are placed with random item requirements (e.g. could need canoe to reach Elfland, or airship to reach Matoya).

title: Unsafe Start
description: May place late-game dungeons in starting area.

title: Enable Archipelago Support
description: Create a game that's compatible with Archipelago Multi-Worlds, allowing different games to share the same treasure pool. By default, only Key Items are included in the common treasure pool. Require Archipelago's client.

title: Add Shards
description: Add Shards to the common treasure pool.

title: Add Gold
description: Add GP treasures to the common treasure pool.

title: Add Consumables
description: Add consumables to the common treasure pool.

title: Add Equipment
description: Add equipment to the common treasure pool.

title: Generated Earth Cave B1
description:
Randomly generates the map for the first level of Earth Cave, creating an entirely new map with each seed.
Note: These maps have a chance to generate floors that cannot be completed (stairs set in areas that cannot be reached by the Light Warriors). Use with caution.

title: Generated Earth Cave B2
description:
Randomly generates the map for the second level of Earth Cave, creating an entirely new map with each seed.
Note: These maps have a chance to generate floors that cannot be completed (stairs set in areas that cannot be reached by the Light Warriors). Use with caution.

title: Marsh and Desert Tiles Deal Damage
description: Marsh and Desert tiles on the overworld deal damage to the party like Lava and Ice tiles in dungeons.

title: Lethal Damage Tiles
description: If a character is at 1 HP, stepping on damage tiles will kill them. If all characters are dead, game over will be triggered.

title: Starting Level
description: Allows you to change the level your party members will be when you start the game.

title: Max Level Cap
description:
Allows you to lower the maximum level, increasing the challenge of the given flagset.
If a range is selected, a random number is choosen from the range.
If starting levels are higher than the maximum level, players will start at that level but will be unable to gain levels.
For beginners it is not recommended to go below level 20.

title: Deep Dungeon
description:
Turns Coneria Castle into a 52-floor completely procedurally generated dungeon.
As you go deeper, the treasures get better and the monster encounters get stronger. Every so often there will be a branch to the next town, but dying or restoring a save will return you to the overworld.
Somewhere within the dungeon is a TAIL and Bahamut; you could encounter them in either order. There are three guaranteed Ribbons and there may be more near the end of the dungeon.
Treasures are rolled independently, not shuffled, so there could be no Masamunes, or you could find so many you're throwing them on the ground.

title: Distribute Treasure Evenly
description: Instead of the value of treasure chest contents increasing as you progress deeper into the dungeon, each box has the same chance of having any kind of content regardless of where in the dungeon you encounter it.

title: Progressive Tilesets
description: Instead of each floor having a random tileset, the first few floors are Castle, the next few floors are Earth/Volcano tileset, and so on, with the final few floors being TOFR tileset. This allows you to have some vague indication of how far into the dungeon you are.

title: Fiend Orbs
description: Instead of the usual NPCs blocking the usual three shortcuts into the dungeon, the fiends guard shortcuts to floors 10, 20, 30, and 40.

title: Bahamut and Tail Floors
description:
Determines how Bahamut and the TAIL are placed in the dungeon relative to each other:
RANDOM: (Default) They could be placed in either order.
TAIL FIRST: Always places the TAIL on or before Bahamut's floor.
BAHAMUT FIRST: Always places the TAIL on or after Bahamut's floor.
SAME FLOOR: Always places the TAIL and Bahamut on the same floor as each other.

title: Thief Lockpicking
description:
Having a thief in the party, when they reach the required level, allows players to open all locked doors. (Selecting level 1 will allow the thief to always unlock doors.)

 Enabling this flag also adds a -10 level requirement bonus and a +10 level requirement malus to blursed classes.

title: Improved HARM for White Mage
description: HARM spells (including via item magic) will deal damage to any target if CAST or USED by a White Mage/White Wizard. On non-undead targets, the spells will not crit (will not deal double damage except on a 3/256), averaging 30/60/90/120 damage for HARM1-4.

title: Use Armor Crafter
description:
Generate random armor. Names are assigned based on casting, elemental resists, or quality. Use 'select' button on the equip or shop screen to view exact stats. For chest armor, gauntlet, and helm, class permissions depend on the armor class, otherwise class permissions depend on the armor type.  There will also always be a set of superior armor that is only usable by the knight.

title: Randomized Access Requirements
description:
Randomize which locations have which access requirements, i.e. whether the SHIP, CANOE, or AIRSHIP is required to access a certain location. Also splits up Coneria and Elfland, placing the towns and castles separately.
For example, with this enabled, it could produce a map where you need to go through Titan's tunnel to access the Temple of Fiends, or accessing Elfland requires the CANOE.
Requires key item shuffle and/or loose items to be enabled.

title: Randomized Access Requirements - Unsafe Start
description: If enabled, mid-game dungeons (Earth, Volcano, Ice and Ordeals) are added to the pool of possible starting area entrances that may be required for early progression.

title: Everything has Death Touch
description:
Adds death touch status attack to every enemy in the game.
Note: Pirates in Pravoka will not have death touch if they are "Safe" Pirates.

title: Everything has Death Touch - Exclude Fiends
description:
When adding death touch status attack to every enemy in the game, the four Fiends, their refights, and Chaos are skipped.
Note: These bosses may still receive death touch when status attacks are shuffled.

title: Increase Dark Penalty
description:
If enabled, "Dark" status severely decreases an attacker's chance to hit or crit an enemy.
Affects both players and enemies inflicted with "Dark" status.

title: Total Orbs Required
description:
Changes the total number of ORBS needed to enter the Temple of Fiends Revisited.

title: Orbs Required - Orb Spoilers
description: When enabled, the Black Orb will explain its requirements.

title: Prevent consecutive NUKE or NUCLEAR
description: When shuffling spell and skill scripts, prevent consecutive casts of NUKE or NUCLEAR without at least one other spell or skill in between.  Also prevents having the starting spell and skill slots filled by both NUKE and NUCLEAR at the same time. (Because one is a spell and one is a skill, it's still rarely possible for NUKE to be activated immediately after NUCLEAR - or vice-versa - later in the fight.)

title: Beginner preset
description: Introduction to the randomizer, and the basis for most of the other presets.

title: Improved Vanilla preset
description: Applies the bugfixes and quality-of-life improvements to the base game, but does not randomize anything.

title: Deep Dungeon preset
description:
Turns Coneria Castle into a 52-floor completely procedurally generated dungeon, leading to Chaos.
As you go deeper, the monster encounters get stronger. Every so often there will be a branch to the next town, but dying or restoring a save will send you back to start.
Key flags
- Save on game over
- Save items replaced by ethers that restore magic charges
- The Tail can be found between floors 10 and 30, before Bahamut.

title: Over Randomizer preset
description:
The randomizer will give you entirely new weapons, armor, spells, and enemies.
Key flags
Weaponizer - see tooltip on the 'Gear & Items'
Armor Crafter - see tooltip on the Gear & Items for details
Spell Crafter - See 'Spellcrafter FAQ' on the Resources page
Enemizer - See 'Enemizer FAQ' on the Resources page

title: Chaos Rush preset
description:
You can challenge Chaos immediately at the start of the game.  How fast can you become strong enough to defeat Chaos?
Key flags
- All 4 Orbs are lit, ToFR is unlocked, and you start with the LUTE
- Your 4 Light Warriors are chosen for you
- Free Ship, Canoe and Airship
- Free TAIL
- High XP and gold scaling
- Low encounter rate
- Short ToFR

title: Hidden Chaos preset
description:
Chaos is hidden in a random chest and must be found to be defeated. Once you've killed Chaos the game ends. If you find Chaos and then lose, fear not -- the fiend will not move and can be tracked down to the same treasure chest to be fought again.
Key flags
- Randomized treasure, high wealth
- Rare and legendary gear in shops
- All 4 Orbs are lit, ToFR is unlocked, and you start with the LUTE, but is anyone home?

title: Entrance and Floor Shuffle preset
description:
Overworld entrances (except for towns) are shuffled together, and shuffles cave and dungeon floors.  For example, the entrance to Waterfall could lead to Earth B1, which may lead to Volcano B3, which leads to Matoya's Cave, etc.
Key flags
- Dungeon encounter rate is slightly lower than Beginner flagset

title: NOverworld preset
description:
Removes overworld from the game entirely, towns and dungeons are connected directly by stairs and warps.  Introduces two new items, the SIGIL and the MARK, which you must find to unlock progression.
Key flags
- Save on death
- Save items replaced with ethers, which restore magic charges
- Start with a random item that casts offensive area-of-effect magic

title: Shard Hunt
description:
The orbs have been shattered and spread across the world.  Find 28 shards to unlock the Temple of Fiends.  Defeating Lich and Kary award 2 shards, Kraken and Tiamat award 4 shards.
Key flags
- Dungeon encounter rate is slightly lower than Beginner flagset

title: Oops, All Loose!
description:
All key items are loose, which means they can be found in any chest.  There may be multiple key items in a dungeon, or none at all.
Key flags
- Dungeon encounter rate is slightly lower than Beginner flagset

title: Procedurally Generated Overworld
description:
Explore a completely new, randomly generated overworld.
- Be aware you will likely need to find the bridge, which will be found in an early game chest.
- The CANAL is required to access a dock that lets you reach the Earth cave.
- The Airship can be found in a distinctive area of desert surrounded by mountains and entered from the south.
- The overworld encounter rate is reduced to assist exploring.

title: Floaterless
description:
Sail the high seas!  The floater has been removed from the game, so you can't get the airship, but new docks, rivers and mountain passes have been added to ensure you can still get everywhere you need to go.
Key flags
- Northern docks let you access the Onrac continent, Bahamut's island, and the Mirage desert.
- A new river dock grants access to the Lefein region, and a mountain pass provides access to Gaia.
- Overworld encounter rate is reduced

title: Free Enterprise
description:
All bosses rush modeled after the open world gameplay style of FF4: Free Enterprise.  Go anywhere in your trusty airship, the Enterprise.  The LUTE, KEY and lighting the four orbs are still required to access the final dungeon.
- Free airship and canoe
- Starting party is two forced, two none.  You will have the opportunity to recruit additional party members by completing quests and defeating fiends.
- No random encounters, gain XP is by finding XP chests, taking spike tile fights, and defeating bosses.
- Every incentive location is in play, with a key item or legendary treasure
- Randomized treasure, high wealth, rare and legendary gear in shops
- Start with a random item that casts offensive area-of-effect magic
- Free TAIL, fight buff Bahamut
- Buffed, unsafe pirates
- Buffed Astos
- Required WarMECH
- Alternate fiends and final boss
- Short ToFR

title: Buffed Astos
description: Give Astos more HP, armor, evade and nasty spells and skills.  Hint: Astos likes status effects, and death.  He can dish it out, but he can't take it.

title: Unsafe Astos
description: Shuffle Astos may place Astos on the King or Princess of Coneria Castle.  This may result in challenging early game progression.

title: TRANCE is status element
description: Adjust enemy skill TRANCE to have 'status' element, so it can be resisted by wearing a Ribbon, casting ARUB, or with other status-protecting spells and gear that may be generated by other flags.

title: Lock Respond Rate
description:
Pressing LEFT or RIGHT on the Title Screen will not change the Respond Rate from its preferred value of 8.
This prevents accidental changes to the text speed during gameplay.

title: Uninterrupted Music
description: Modifies the chime that plays when opening standard treasure chests so music keeps playing instead of restarting after every chest. (Incentivized items playing the longer fanfare tune remain unchanged.)

title: Relocate Chests
description: Relocate chests and enemy trap tiles to new locations in castles and dungeons.

title: Relocated trap tiles are marked
description: Relocated trap tiles will be marked.

title: Open Chests In Order
description:
Non incentive items are opened in order. 

Warning, if your inventory gets full it will block your equipment progress.
